title: HashiCorp at AWS re:Invent: Your blueprint for cloud success
content:
Amazon Web Services’ flagship cloud conference — AWS re:Invent — is back, and this year HashiCorp’s presence is bigger than ever. (You can still register to attend in-person or remotely.) For both in-person and remote attendees, we’re pleased to share the latest news on our long-standing relationship with Amazon and how we help organizations provision, secure, run, and connect applications running in AWS.

Whether organizations go fully cloud-native or maintain a hybrid infrastructure combining cloud and on-premises resources, HashiCorp products are instrumental in supporting those diverse environments. For many organizations, HashiCorp Terraform is the preferred way to provision resources on AWS at scale. Similarly, HashiCorp Vault is central to adopting zero trust security on AWS. And increasingly, HashiCorp Consul is how DevOps teams choose to automate networking across AWS runtimes.

HashiCorp and AWS recently achieved a remarkable milestone: 2 billion downloads of the AWS provider for Terraform — less than one year after the provider reached 1 billion downloads. This milestone underscores the growing recognition of the need for standardized infrastructure as code (IaC) solutions as organizations scale. Terraform plays a pivotal role in empowering application teams to compose, reuse, and collaborate effectively on infrastructure provisioning, ultimately accelerating the build and deployment process.

In 2023, HashiCorp is an Emerald sponsor of re:Invent and we have a full program of events where attendees can learn and network at the show. Here are some highlights:

Visit us at booth 800

Stop by our booth at the main entrance for daily demos and technical sessions on how to provision, secure, connect, and run applications on AWS.

  • Product demos: Meet with technical experts and stop by our booth theater for hourly 15-minute demos on Terraform, Vault, Consul, and more.
  • Technical deep dives: Get your questions answered at whiteboard sessions about specifics across our infrastructure and security portfolio.
  • Limited-edition swag: Learn about our products and play in the HashiCorp booth Game Zone to win exclusive swag.
  • Integration highlights: Learn more about how we integrate and innovate with AWS to boost developer productivity, mitigate risk, and maximize cloud investments.
  • Community: Come meet with us and learn more about our products, local user groups, certifications, learning, and more.

Find us on stage

HashiCorp will be presenting three breakout sessions at re:Invent. Sign up in the AWS Session Catalog for the sessions below:

Building a multi-account, multi-runtime, service-oriented architecture

Tuesday, Nov. 28 from 11 a.m. - 12 p.m. | Caesar’s Palace - Forum 121

  • As organizations scale their applications and teams, adopting a service-oriented architecture (SOA) can improve scalability, flexibility, and agility. This session will walk through a journey from zero to scale, discussing when and how an organization should implement SOA. Attendees will learn how to set up a multi-account, multi-runtime microservices architecture at scale using Amazon ECS, EKS, and EC2 along with HashiCorp Terraform, Consul, Boundary, and Vault.
  • Session ID: DOP316-S

Run modern PKI workflows with HCP Vault on AWS

Tuesday, Nov. 28 from 2 p.m. - 3 p.m. | Venetian - Murano 3306

  • Learn how to use HCP Vault with AWS Certificate Manager to enable your organization's modern PKI, certificate authority, and certificate management workflows to secure service-to-service communication on Amazon EKS. By leveraging Vault workflows and automation, you can avoid expensive expired certificate outages and run more efficiently without a lot of manual processes or heroics.
  • Session ID: SEC201-S

Self-service infrastructure is no longer a dream

Wednesday, Nov. 29 from 11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. | Venetian - Bellini 2105

  • Platform teams can use Terraform Cloud, HCP Waypoint, and the AWS Service Catalog to create simplified Terraform-based workflows for developers. Modern Terraform modules can incorporate unit testing, built-in security, policy enforcement, and reliable version updates. Using these tools, you can establish standardized workflows to deploy applications and deliver a smooth and seamless developer experience.
  • Session ID: DOP315-S

Sign up for AWS and Terraform notable sessions

Check the AWS session catalog for AWS-led talks and workshops featuring Terraform. Just search for “Terraform” in the session catalog search bar. Here are a few suggestions:

Code Talk | COP405 | Coding for account customizations at scale

  • Nov. 29 | 9 a.m - 10 a.m. (PDT) at the Wynn

Chalk Talk | SVS312 | Building serverless applications with Terraform

  • Nov. 27 | 1 p.m. - 2 p.m. at Mandalay Bay

Chalk Talk | SEC319-R | Enhance cloud security: Using AWS SRA with Terraform

  • Nov. 27 | 10.30 a.m. - 11:30 a.m. at Caesar’s Forum

Workshop | ROB301 | Connected worker safety with robots and Terraform

  • Nov. 29 | 5:30 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. at Caesar’s Forum

More ways to connect and learn

In celebration of 2 billion downloads of the Terraform AWS provider and more community milestones, we are hosting events for our customers and extended community.

HashiCorp will host a Terraform Thursday breakfast on Thursday, Nov. 30 at 7 a.m. at CHICA Las Vegas to say thank you and network with our Terraform contributors and collaborators. Please share your interest in attending and note that you will need a conference pass to attend.

Product and engineering leaders (C-suite, executive, and VP leadership) from software companies and digital businesses can sign up for the AWS for Software Companies Executive Forum on Monday, Nov. 27, where Armon Dadgar, HashiCorp Chief Technical Officer and Co-Founder, will be participating in an executive roundtable.

To learn more, book a meeting with us, meet other customers, or chat with experts at AWS re:Invent, please visit

https://events.hashicorp.com/awsreinvent2023.
author: Melissa Gurney Greene
